weather_report:
In the hush of the night, Downtown San Francisco is cloaked in a shroud of muted clouds, casting a serene ambiance that whispers of the cool breath of winter. With temperatures dipping to around 44 degrees, a gentle north-northwest wind stirs through the streets, creating a crispness in the air that hints at the promise of a fresh dawn. As morning unfurls into Sunday, expect a playful interplay of clouds and sun, with peaks of blue revealing themselves as the day progresses. The air will warm only slightly, reaching a modest high near 53, before slipping a notch by the afternoon—a reminder of the ever-present maritime embrace this city knows so well.

The fog, with its ethereal charm, is likely to be lingering close to the ocean’s embrace but may clear away to reveal a panorama of the iconic bridges and hills, albeit softened by the ever-looming marine layer. As for dressing for the day, layering remains a safe bet; a comfortable sweater or light jacket will serve well against any lingering chill and prepare you for the subtle winds as they whisper down the avenues. It’s a day best spent enjoying the mellow glow of cafes or exploring the tranquil coastal trails, the streets adorned with the soft allure of the city, inviting a leisurely stroll amid the scenic beauty that is uniquely San Francisco.
